subject: Re: [junit] Testing Strategy for Business Objects
msgSnippet: Have you looked at Fit testing framework? -d ... From: david.f.carver  To:  Sent: Thursday, April 10, 2003
messageBody:
Have you looked at Fit testing framework?
-d
----- Original Message -----
From: "david.f.carver" <david.f.carver@...>
To: <junit@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Thursday, April 10, 2003 1:43 PM
Subject: [junit] Testing Strategy for Business Objects


> All,
>
> I am looking for some insight into a project that I've just begun. We are
using an in-house developed code generator that uses an xml file and an 4
xsl files and transform them into four Java classes. The Java classes serve
as the data abstraction layer. I would like to maintain some tracebility
from the customer who describes the business process and the code that makes
the calls to the database. Has anyone had experience with this type of
thing? If so, please offer suggestions on how to use Junit to do this and
the tests that I might use.
>
> Thanks,
> David
>
